subject: Investing
title: When Bonds Beat Stocks
description: A quick win: understand When Bonds Beat Stocks.

hook.text: From 2000 to 2009, bonds returned 84% while the S&P 500 returned negative 9%. The 'lost decade' for stocks.

buildup.text: Bonds outperform stocks during deflation, recessions, and periods of falling interest rates.

discovery.text: Long-term Treasuries gained 17% in 2008 while stocks lost 37%. Bonds are crisis insurance that actually pays.

twist.text: Bonds rarely beat stocks over 20-year periods. The lost decade was an exception, not the norm.

climax.text: The lesson isn't that bonds are better. It's that the right mix protects you from the wrong decade.

punchline.text: Stocks win the marathon. Bonds win the emergencies.

quiz.question: During which period did bonds significantly outperform US stocks?
